result.execSummary:
The defendant Chue Vang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week, and if not so fully engaged complete 9 hours community service per week.

Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed. 

No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Assessment, treatment, counseling deemed appropriate by agent. 

DNA sample. 

AODA and follow through.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: I/S to be used for rules violations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chue Vang

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  4:00 p.m. 
INCLUDES 22CF349, 22CF901.
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. 
Defendant appears in custody from MCJ with Atty Adam Fontana. 

Date and time set for plea/sentencing hearing; VRCW.  
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

22CF349>>>State moves to DRI Count 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater); COURT grants. 

22CF901>>>State moves to DRI Count 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater) and Count 3 (Bail Jumping-Felony/Repeater); COURT grants. 

PLEA: 

22CF349:  Count 1 (Misappropriate ID Info-Avoid Penalty/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST.  

22CF901:  Count 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS on both cases: SWH for 2 years probation; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  AODA and follow through. Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week.  Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.  No possession of drug paraphernalia.  I/S 90 days MCJ to be used for rule violations.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge. 

COURT grants 47 days credit in 22CF349 and 39 days credit in 22CF901.

Adj:  4:14 p.m.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  8:47 a.m. 
INCLUDES 22CF349, 22CF901.
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. 
Defendant appears in person with Atty Adam Fontana. 

Date and time set for bond modification hearing. 
ADA Coonen makes objections to bond modifications. 
Atty Fontana makes statement re: ATR. 

COURT makes findings and denies bond modification. 

Adj:  8:49 a.m.

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 9:08 am 
INCLUDES 22CF349 AND 22CF901. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Adam Fontana. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Informations to be E-filed.  Readings Waived.
Plea: Not Guilty on both files. 
Calendar Call set for 8/10/2022 at 8:05 am with Br. 4 JA. 
Adj: 9:11 am 

cc: Br. 4

records.addlTxt:
Clerk:  Amy. 
Called: 2:05 p.m. 
INCLUDES 22CF349, 22CF901.
State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck.   Defendant appears in custody, via Zoom Video, and with Atty Vanessa Avila. 

Date and time set for initial appearance.
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 

BOND:  $2000.00 signature bond with first $500.00 cash to include both cases. 

CONDITIONS: 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  
- Same conditions from previous bond in 22CF349; No contact with C.H.Y. 
- ATTIC services at Level 4.  

RH:  7/29/22 at 1:00 p.m. 
PH:  8/03/22 at 9:00 a.m., Branch 6.  

Adj: 2:09 p.m. 

Branch 4 case.

$2000 signature bond with the first $500 Cash. Includes 22CF349 & 22CF901. No contact with victim(s): C.H.Y.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.   Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  No possession of drug paraphernalia.    Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.   Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
